alert.note: Alert for Edwards (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 9:23PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Edwards County through 1015 PM CDT... At 922 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Rocksprings, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Edwards County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for south central Texas.
